sen.j: 光悦村（こうえつむら）は、本阿弥光悦らが営んだ江戸時代初期の芸術村。
sen.e: Koetsu mura was an art village managed by Koetsu HONAMI in the early Edo Period.
Koetsu mura was a village that flourished in arts and crafts, and managed by Koetsu HONAMI during the early Edo Period.

sen.j: 本阿弥光悦が、江戸幕府から与えられた、京都の鷹ヶ峰の地に、さまざまな分野の、町衆の文化人や職人、芸術家たちを集めて、独自の文化を築きあげた。
sen.e: Koetsu HONAMI gathered artisans and artists from machi-shu (towns people) in various fields in a land of Takagamine, Kyoto, given from Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and built up a unique culture.

sen.j: 光悦の屋敷跡は光悦寺（京都市北区鷹峯光悦町）といわれる。
sen.e: The site of the residence of Koetsu is said to be Koetsu-ji Temple (Takagaminekoetsu-cho, Kita Ward, Kyoto City).
